poem:
"Pernicious Hearth"

In the glow of warming flame,
An unseen serpent hisses,
Poisoning air with breath of blame,
Mocking domestic blisses. 

The poor, the brown bear burden more,
For progress, blind and heartless,
Where rich men's comfort, opulence's whore,
Feeds a world grown dark and breathless. 

Heralded by chromed god, NO2,
Pays its fine in human breath,
Yet who will stem such darkened dew,
Until it whispers death?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gas stoves increase nitrogen dioxide exposure above WHO standards – study Using a gas stove increases nitrogen dioxide exposure to levels that exceed public health recommendations, a new study shows. The report, published Friday in Science Advances, found that people of color and low-income residents in the US were disproportionately affected. Indoor gas and propane appliances raise average concentrations of the harmful pollutant, also known as NO2, to 75% of the World Health Organization’s standard". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
